description: A longsword, made out of a very dark, almost black metal.  It seems to hold a greater edge than usual steel blades and feels â€¦more comfortable in the hand.  While the blade is made out of this dark metal, the crossguard and the pommel seem to be made out of a brighter material, which feels abnormally cool to the touch.
This is a polearm with an axe head, a small hammer on the back, and a short dagger-like spike on top.  It's less heavy than most polearms and has a smaller head, making it slightly quicker.

A thrusting sword adopted by Ancient Rome during the conquest of the Iberian Peninsula, the "gladius hispaniensis" supplanted the hasta as the most common weapon of the Roman Legions, until the shift towards the longer spatha during the later days of the Empire.
